Articles.Content:
Ask me for demo, my Steam name is legoclone09. Please state your Steam name before adding though, I usually ignore. Just reply or PM me.

I just played this awesome Counter-Strike game, I carried. Make sure you have Counter-Strike : Global Offensive on Steam before asking! When the link is clicked on, it should open Counter-Strike and download the video in-game, if you don't have CSGO, it will download normally. Do not click if CS:GO is not installed/owned. I will upload a YouTube video once I get it done.

Edited September 17, 2015 by legoclone09

I just played this awesome csgo game, I carried. Make sure you have CSGO on Steam and have Steam open! [snip]

Could you change the link to one which won't automatically download it? I hit cancel, but I still don't know what it is. Thanks!

Edited September 16, 2015 by Vanamonde

Oh, its a CSGO demo. When you open it, the match video will be downloaded in CSGO. Not tested with non-CS players, reslts could be weird. If it is a .dem or .dem.info file, it's the demo.

Demo is the gameplay.

I just played this awesome csgo game, I carried. Make sure you have CSGO on Steam and have Steam open! [snip]

I know that you are a legitimate forum goer, but otherwise your posts has all the hallmarks of a spear fishing attack. Ambiguous title and something that tries to execute right away without it being apparent what it is. For our protection, it would probably be best if you are quite a bit more descriptive.

Edited September 16, 2015 by Vanamonde
Please provide a non-download link. It's polite to give people a choice about that sort of thing.
I also don't know what a "CSGO" is.

I also don't know what a "CSGO" is.

A Russian thing

A Russian thing

I just googled it, it stands for: "Counter Strike: Global Offensive."

I just googled it, it stands for: "Counter Strike: Global Offensive."

Exactly.
